business

Class Die

  • java.lang.Object
    • business.Die
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Readable, Rollable

    public class Die
extends java.lang.Object
implements Readable, Rollable
    Author:
    Sara Wille The Die object has a number of sides and a side that is face up. The number of sides must be set when the Die is instantiated. The die can be rolled, the face up side can be read, and the face up side can be displayed.

    • Method Detail

      • dieVisual1

        public static java.lang.String dieVisual1(int faceUp)
        dieVisual1() - Creates the first line of a three line visual to display the number on the face up side of the die. The Hand object is then used to compile a String of dice that display side by side depending on how many dice are in the hand.
        Parameters:
        faceUp -
        Returns:
        row1

        public int getSides()
        getSides() - Getter for integer variable sides.

      • readFaceUp

        public int readFaceUp()
        readFaceUp() - Overrides the readFaceUp() method implemented from Readable. The Die's face up side is returned as an integer.
        Specified by:
        readFaceUp in interface Readable
        Returns:
        faceUp

      • roll

        public void roll()
        roll() - Overrides the roll() method implemented from Rollable. The Die is "rolled": the face up side is set to a random number, assuming each side of the die is a number from 1 to the number of sides.
        Specified by:
        roll in interface Rollable
